bill_title: permit persons sixty-five or older to request that they be excused from jury duty.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to permit persons sixty-five or older to request that they be excused from jury duty. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 16-13-10 be amended to read as follows: 16-13-10. All citizens Any citizen of this state, who are residents is a resident of the county or jury district where the jury is selected, eighteen years of age or older prior to January first of the year of jury service, of sound mind and who are is able to read, write, and understand the English language, are is eligible to serve as jurors a juror . Justices No Justice or clerks clerk of the Supreme Court or a nor any judge of the circuit court or any court of the United States, or a court of limited jurisdiction, or licensed attorneys are not attorney is eligible to serve as jurors a juror . Clergymen Any member of the clergy, as defined in § 19-13-16 , if jury service conflicts with their religious beliefs may be exempt from jury duty. Persons Any person who have has been convicted of a felony unless restored to their civil rights are is not eligible to serve as jurors a juror . Potential jurors No potential juror may not be excluded from jury duty on the basis of a visual or hearing impairment. However, if any person sixty-five years of age or older requests to be excused from jury duty, the judge or the clerk of courts shall excuse that person. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
